@SpoonyOne 
First of all there are people who buy the game from the first time,people which will not buy it anyway 
and people who try the game before they buy it. 
Anyway the producers dont lose nothing because of piracy on the contrary they win the people who try, like it and then buy the game. 
This people (maybe not many but some) would not buy it if they would not have the chance to try it.
As for the ones who dont buy it they would not purchase the game in no case, even if they dont have piracy as a source. 
On the other hand who wats to play this games have to invest in serious hardware and give money to Amd or Nvidia who 
in their turn sponsor the major manufacturers of games.
So bottom line is that piracy more helps than hurts.
And for your stupid tv analogy I dont think you buy a black box only because some guy tells you is a awesome tv inside.

Having an issue with this install, can't figure out why.

I installed as usual, ran the SKIDROW update, copied over the crack.

Tried running the game through the launcher.exe and through the Alanwake.exe.

The first run through I received an error about the .dll file, fixed that, now it is saying 

Could not preprocess HLSL shader n/a.

Now I'm no dummy, but I just can't figure this out.  Any polite pointers to help a brotha out?

Ignore my ignorance, I figured it out.  go to C:\program files(x86)\Remedy Entertainment\ Alan Wake\ thirdparty\Directx  and run the DXSETUP.  Problem solved and now I feel like a tard for not seeing it myself.

Problem solved haven't played it yet, just opened to the main screen minimized and felt like flaunting my ignorance.

To unlock nightmare difficulty from the beginning..
Go to the Alan Wake icon on your desktop
Right Click
Properties
and add this to the target line and start by putting a space from the quotation marks
-developermenu
you will get a new option 'developer menu' with which you can unlock the mode.

For those who can't continue the game (load save game), you can change app id number in SKIDROW.ini (default 108710) to whatever, like 108711. BUT with this you can't continue the old save game, but  at least you can start a new game and continue after quiting the game.

********PROBLEM d3dx9_43 FIXED********

 first problem : d3dx9_43

1 .  go to the site " dll file" 
2 .  type in the search bar d3dx9_43 
3 .  dowload only the zip file then extract it
4 .  place it in the program files(x86)/Remedy Entertainment/alan wake

second problem: Could no preprocess HLSL shader - n/a
1 . copy the following adress :

http://www.dll-files.com/search.php?q=hlsl

2 . dowload the 3 files then extract them
3 . place them in the program files(x86)/Remedy Entertainment/alan wake
4 . play and regret that you haven't a good graphic card
